title: Ticket #4102: Complete rescue DAGs have incorrect node priorities
description:
When writing a complete ("old-style") rescue DAG, the node priorities that are written are the calculated priorities, not the priorities actually set in the original DAG file. The rescue DAG file should duplicate the original DAG file in this.

For the current priority scheme, I think this will not actually cause incorrect priorities; but for some of the proposed changes in #4024, it would cause incorrect priorities when the rescue DAG is run.
remarks:
2013-Dec-16 13:22:19 by wenger:
Note: we could get rid of this issue by just no longer allowing old-style rescue DAGs...

2013-Dec-19 12:33:21 by wenger:
Made V8_0-gittrac_4102-branch branch for this.

2013-Dec-23 07:23:49 by wenger:
Also add warnings if user defines a VARS macro called "priority", because that would conflict with the priority implementation.

2014-Jan-31 15:08:05 by wenger:
I probably want to put this into 8.1 instead of 8.0 -- the changes are awfully complex for the stable series, and I'm not sure the bug is important enough to try to break out just the minimum changes needed to fix the priorities in old-style rescue DAGs, especially since I think there's still a case where you get the wrong priorities...

2014-Aug-28 10:06:10 by wenger:
I'm going to mark this ticket as abandoned because of #4563: Disable "old-style" (complete) rescue DAGs.
derived_tickets: #4563   Disable complete (as opposed to partial) rescue DAGs
